Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Abduct \Ab*duct"\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Abducted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Abducting}.] [L. abductus, p. p. of abducere. See {Abduce}.] 1. To take away surreptitiously by force; to carry away (a human being) wrongfully and usually by violence; to kidnap. [1913 Webster]
2. To draw away, as a limb or other part, from its ordinary position. [1913 Webster]
abducted adj : (of persons) seized and detained unlawfully, often for ransom; "the father restored the kidnapped (or abducted) child to the mother" [syn: {kidnapped}, {kidnaped}]
